Rules

[01] VOTING METHOD: Votes must be in bold. example: Vote: LlamaFluff If you do not bold your vote, it will not be counted. You do not have to unvote before casting another vote, but it would be appreciated.

[02] LYNCH: Lynching will require a simple majority of votes. Once a player has reached the necessary majority, any attempts to unvote will be unheeded.

[03] NO LYNCH: You may vote: no lynch – unless it is deadline, majority votes of this kind are necessary to end the day without a death.

[04] DEADLINE: This game will have mandatory deadlines of, at most, 2 weeks. As the game whittles down its living membership deadlines may grow shorter. If I deem it necessary a player being replaced may extend the deadline.

[05] DEADLINE LYNCH RULES: At deadline, a person will be lynched if they have a majority of voters voting for them. That means you can be lynched with just one vote if only one person is voting. If no one has a majority of the votes cast, it is a no-lynch.

[06] NIGHT CHOICES: Night choices will be expected within 48 hours. If you do not inform me of a night choice you will forfiet it.

[07] LURKING AND NOT POSTING: Lurking is not an acceptable strategy in this game. Anyone who goes more than 48 hours without posting, without advance warning, will be prodded. Failure to post in the 48 hours following a prod will result in a player being replaced. Mafia is a social contract. Everyone is expected to give information and comment to be analysed. If this is uncomfortable for you, consider taking up solitaire instead.

[08] OUT OF THREAD COMMUNICATION: The game is not to be discussed outside the thread unless your role specifically states that you may do so – and then only in the manner stated in your role PM. Don’t quote any out-of-thread communications regarding this game in the thread, this includes role PMs.

[09] BAH POSTS ARE ALLOWED: Once your death scene has been posted, you’re dead. However, since I love Bah posts you may absolutely make one "Bah" post. It should be short and should contain absolutely no game related opinion or information.

[10] TOO CLEVER BY HALF RULE: No small or hidden text or obscure codes. Don’t edit/delete previously submitted posts either.

[11] VACATION? LIMITED ACCESS? If you anticipate being unavailable for more than a 48-hour period, please post a notice to that effect in this game thread. Treat this game as a commitment. Be considerate – don’t leave us hanging.

[12] FALLIBILITY CLAUSE: Unlike other mods I am fallible. Please point out any mistakes I make gently. In particular, if I post a vote count that does not accurately reflect your vote, it is your responsibility to correct me -- otherwise your vote may be treated as it appears in the vote count.

[13] QUESTIONS: If you have any questions at all, please PM me or post the question in the thread.

[14] HUSH NOW, QUIET NOW: Excessive use of CAPS POSTING or spamming posts will not be allowed and may result in replacement without warning.

[15] GAMBLERS ANON: No bets, deals, promises, etc are allowed. Depending on the severity of one you may be modkilled or forceably replaced.

[16] IF IT QUACKS LIKE A DUCK: If you fake breaking a rule, it will result in the same punishment as actually breaking the rule.

[17] FUN: Remember, it’s a game and it’s supposed to be fun. Be nice to your fellow players and your mod. I have very low tolerance for abusive posts.

[18] I've reserved this color for any purposes I might choose. Don't use it or anything similar to it.


The following is the Vanilla Townie role PM. At least one player in the game received this role.

You are a Vanilla Townie.

You have no special abilities, only your vote and your voice.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated, and there is at least one pro-town player left alive.

Roles are going out.

All roles have gone out, if you did not receive a role let me know ASAP. Please confirm by PM.

Day one will start September 5th, 1PM PST

Day one has started.

Deadline for day one is September 19th, 1PM PST
With 12 alive it takes 7 to lynch

It seems odd to me that you would choose to label the series of posts as a backtrack, and not CO2 trying to figure out what exactly buddying is in the first place.

I don't necessarily think backtracking has a negative connotation, I fully believe that as a new player he could be confused by terminology frequently used. I was more asking to see what CO2s response was. I would like to see what Val says about his reasoning for his vote as well though. He says he is interested in what CO2 has to say but proceeds to vote Nad, so I was just curious as to what his reasoning was.

CO2 reads fairly town to me based on his responses to questions and his explanation of his misunderstanding.

I want to know what McStab thinks of CO2s recent posts.

I don't think this early in the game a vote with no reasoning is necessarily a scum tell...depending on who the vote is. Hooplas unexplained vote was on CO2 which already had a small wagon forming, that I don't like, but Demoncores vote was on someone who as far as I can see has no votes so far...therefore it's not hopping on a wagon. Still early though.
Also sorry about the double post earlier. I post from my phone on occasion when my laptop is not around, sometimes it does that. :/

The roles we've had flipped and claimed (Doctor and 1-shot Tracker) gel perfectly with a 2:10 setup - these are exactly the sort of roles you'd likely see, and with a lack of second nightkill, I find it unlikely we've got a Serial Killer. Unless several other PR's get claimed/flipped, we're probably playing in a 2:10 setup, which will turn this into a game of process of elimination rather than trying to catch scum via association.

I'm tempted to do a little bandwagon analysis, given the makeup of the final D1 wagon is quite unusual:

Vote Count

Starbuckles (7) - BT, Scumhunter, McStab, Ranmaru, Carbondioxide, Dunhumganger, Cartographer
Scumhunter (1) - scooby
Ranmaru (1) - Hoopla

Not Voting (3) - Elias_the_thief, Starbuckles, KingdomAces


From my perspective, McStab is quite likely to be a 1-Shot Tracker. I think unless he was dealt this role as scum and trueclaimed, he'd fakeclaim something with more upside to keeping him alive, like a full Tracker perhaps. Given the nature of the setup, if he really is a 1-Shot Tracker, then it is likelier he is on the town's side as it seems somewhat pointless to give this role to scum when there is likely going to be little town power to track.

This should make it reasonably likely that Scumhunter is town too, as such an investigation would catch Scumhunter ~50% of the time. Admittedly, scum would likely kill with their towniest looking player, which Scumhunter probably wouldn't have been, as a few people thought he was suspect yesterday, which slightly reduces the value of this investigation, but I believe it still has merit, and to even consider lynching Scumhunter we ought to very suspicious of him - I'm not going to lynch Scumhunter on a mild scum read, when we have a result half-clearing him.

It also begs the question: if McStab is town, why did scum opt to leave him alive, particularly when they (presumably) don't have a Roleblocker? Doc-fear and the fact the PR expires after N1 might be an answer. They could have believed that they had a townie enough looking player to evade the track. They also could have believed that McStab's claim was still seen as sketchy and could be used as mislynch fodder deeper in the game if left alive. Regardless, I think there are enough reasons to keep him alive that it shouldn't detract from his claim being likely town. I don't expect everyone to fully agree with me here, given I'm basing this on setup speculation more so than anything else, but I'm moderately confident in this read, and subsequently Scumhunter's innocence.

Following on from this, this is how I see the lynch wagon with that information factored in:

Vote Count

Ranmaru (1) - Hoopla

For me, I find it weird that all my town reads and prob-townies based on PoE are all on the Starbuckle wagon. It wouldn't surprise me if any of Ranmaru, CO2 or Cartographer are scum, but I think it's a trap to read too deeply into this snapshot alone. The thing I find with trying to pick out scum on a wagon, is that it's highly dependent on how much pressure scum under during the day;

If no scum has been wagoned or is looking like a likely candidate throughout the day, scum have little to no incentive to push through a lynch on a townie - all this achieves is blood on their own hands, when a townie could have been lynched without them anyway, giving them an easy high ground to cast potshots at L-1, hammer votes, or the wagon in general.

If scum has come under pressure at some point, and especially if competing wagons between two or three players features one scum, you tend to get a higher ratio of scum on the townie's wagons due to perceived pressure. This usually triggers scum to commit to a bus or push the town wagon harder.

The (likely) lower ratio of scum in this game initially made me hesitant to do some bandwagon analysis, as scum have less influence on wagons overall (and I don't often do wagon analysis as early as D2), but because we have a lot of likely townies all appearing on one wagon, I think this is enough flips/likely flips to eke out some conclusions. Here is what I think:

The collapse of the McStab wagon as we were approaching deadline gave us some interesting information. We were in limbo, with as many as five possible people who could have been lynched. Here is how the votes stood:

Vote Count

Cartographer (2) - KingdomAces, McStab

Ranmaru (2) - Hoopla, Dunhamganger
Hoopla (1) - Carbondioxide
McStab (1) - Ranmaru

Not Voting (2) - Elias_the_thief, Starbuckles


Other than McStab, any of those players could have been lynched, including myself. From my perspective, most of the options would have resulted in a town mislynch. After a brief lull, McStab broke the deadlock and voted Starbuckles, which was immediately followed by Ranmaru shifting onto the wagon with little other reasoning than it nearing deadline. This could merely be self-preservation as either alignment, but it's mildly scummy, as scum-Ranmaru has much more to lose in this situation than town-Ranmaru.

CO2 jumps on the Starbuckles wagon immediately after Ranmaru citing the same slip as everyone else. If anything, I find this vote to be likelier town than Ranmaru's, purely because Starbuckles' wagon was essentially locked in at this stage (or very close to it), so there was no need to jump on the wagon - the only reason to as scum would be to indirectly protect against another wagon collecting votes (his own or his buddy). Given CO2 had no votes, and every other competing wagon except Ranmaru/Cartographer was scum, CO2 would have to be scum with either of those players - and I don't see him being scum with Ranmaru, immediately following him onto a mislynch using the same "slip" reasoning as him - it's too obvious, and new players tend to subconsciously steer clear of that. I don't really think CO2 is scum because of this, and if we are to lynch from the wagon it should be Ranmaru or Cartographer.

Now, onto Cartographer. He was particularly active around deadline and was proactive with hammering Starbuckles, which I always interpret as town behaviour. Since replacing into Demon Core's slot, he was been pretty proactive in general which is a positive sign, but I also get a gut read that Demon Core was town based on how that wagon collapsed - it was largely due to natural causes, without any obvious indirect pushes occurring on other wagons. The only defenses Demon Core got were obvious ones, with scooby and Dunham both saying Demon Core was obv-town. I find that if scooby is scum, he's much likelier to say such a thing about a townie than his (only) buddy. If both defenders are town, then the defenses don't matter, and means the wagon wasn't being defended by scum.

I find the lack of "pushing" during the crucial deadlock (where five candidates existed), implies that there is at most one scum there. If Cartographer/Ranmaru was scum, I'd expect more aggression when the McStab wagon was nearing its close, and when it collapsed. The game being quiet when there are two possible scum that could be suddenly flash-wagoned makes no sense, which is why I rule out Ranmaru/Cartographer as a team also. At most, I see one scum in Ranmaru/CO2/Cartographer, with mild town reads on the last two. If any on the Starbuckles wagon is scum, it is likely to be Ranmaru, in my opinion.

We also need to consider which player(s) off the wagon make sense as scum too. Of scooby/Elias/Kingdom, I'm inclined towards scooby, solely on the basis that Elias/Kingdom make less sense as a scumpartner for Ranmaru, but I'll make a separate analysis post on those three independent of Ranmaru's alignment.

I'll answer this since it's relevant to what's happening now.

I think there might still be scum on the wagon, but I think your rebuttal of my interpretation of your vote was fair, which was a key component in how I was reading the deadline play. If you're town, then it's highly likely no scum was under pressure at all during the deadline (and prior to it), which makes the base of the lynch wagon and off it completely suspicious, as players in tilt votes and actually forwarding the game tend not to scum.

To give an example of this, in Mini 1272, there were competing wagons on townies all day, with scum under zero pressure. This produced this set of votes:

Lady Lambdadelta (7) - implosion, Scumhunter, Katsuki, Hoopla, Amrun, Samuel L Jackson, Fate
Katsuki (4) - redtail896, Juls, Lady Lambdadelta, Mist Beauty
implosion (1) - PeregrineV
redtail896 (1) - Quilford

Not Voting (0)


You'll note zero scum being on the wagon, and with redtail and Peregrine, they sat on their votes the majority of the day - they had no real reason to jump on the LLD wagon or make big statements about anything in general. However, if Katsuki was scum, it is much more likely we would have seen LLD's wagon feature one or two scum in the middle of the wagon powering it ahead before katsuki's wagon can be a threat OR later on the LLD wagon if Katsuki's wagon is stronger (once a certain tipping point reaches, it opens up bussing decisions for scum too).

But since scum were under zero pressure, they don't move votes or make controversial moves. It's much easier to maintain the status quo. This is why you see scum in early positions on the lynch wagon OR not on the lynch wagon at all when there is no pressure. You can see the votecount of this game paints that picture. I've collected data, skimmed, read or played in hundreds of games and have seen this general pattern occur over and over again. Lack of pressure equals lack of risks taken, and you can generally deduce the risk of a vote by position or context in a game.

To apply this logic to the game we're playing now: If you're town, then it's highly likely scum were under little to no pressure throughout the majority of D1, which means we should expect players off the wagon or at the base of the lynch wagon (away from the riskier/more proactive votes). So, looking at our D1 wagon:

Vote Count

Starbuckles (7) - BT, Scumhunter, McStab, Ranmaru, Carbondioxide, Dunhumganger, Cartographer
Scumhunter (1) - scooby
Ranmaru (1) - Hoopla

Not Voting (3) - Elias_the_thief, Starbuckles, KingdomAces


You can see the base of Starbuckles wagon is largely town, so we realistically should be looking at those OFF the wagon. The reason why I was going after you (Ranmaru) earlier was because you being scum makes sense from the perspective of why that vote is being made. Because the only other realistic option is 3:9, and to balance 3:9's you need at least 2 strong PR's + a Vig OR 4 middling/strong PR's to balance it. LlamaFluff is aware of this and knows how difficult it is to balance a 3:9 game, and one of the most efficient ways of balancing a 3:9 (with a vig) isn't an option given he hates the role (and we had only one NK). LlamaFluff values the purity of scumhunting, so he isn't going to pump the game with loads of roles to balance a 3:9. He'll have a 2-3 weakish roles in a 2:10.

We could be playing in a 2:1:9 with a Mafia Traitor, but that's the only other option (and is a lot less likely imo).

I'm not going to argue LlamaFluff's hatred of vigs, but why would this game be a 12p instead of a 13p if there wasn't some role that could cause an extra death to occur at night? It doesn't have the excuse that most 10:2/9:3's did that 12p is the max player cap, so there has to be some reason why the game started on evens. Would there be a way to balance a role like that without needing to make it 3:9?

Extra death at night isn't required - a night without a kill has a similar outcome in getting town to odd numbers. So, stuff like Docs/JK/RB/Hider were to be expected regardless of it being 2:10 or 3:9. Obviously you need less if it's 2:10.
